elements.title: McKinsey - The net-zero transition: What it would cost, what it could bring
elements.description: We estimate the changes in demand, capital spending, costs, and jobs, to 2050, for sectors that produce about 85 percent of overall emissions and assess economic shifts for 69 countries.

elements.title: Solar on superstores
elements.description: A report by Environment America Research & Policy Center and Frontier Group showing the potential of PV installations on rooftop of superstores. The United States has the technical potential to produce 78 times as much electricity as it used in 2020 just with solar photovoltaic (PV) energy.

elements.title: Energy information administration US predicts PV and storage to comprise 60% of new energy
elements.description: A report published in December 2021 by EIA shows projects 78GW of generating capacity additions in 2022 through 2023. A majority of the additions will be large-scale solar and energy storage projects, forecast to add 62% of the total figure, [in the news](https://www.pv-magazine.com/2021/12/28/pv-and-energy-storage-expected-to-comprise-62-of-us-capacity-additions-2022-23/)

elements.title: BESS anticipated to grow with a rate of more than 4.8% over the forecast period 2020-2027
elements.description: Advanced Battery Energy Storage System Market Growth Statistics 2021 Industry Demand, Share Evaluation, Prominent Players Strategies, Size, SWOT Analysis, COVID-19 Impacts and Recovery, Forthcoming Developments, Upcoming Investments and Forecast to 2030. Report available for purchase [here](https://reportocean.com/industry-verticals/sample-request?report_id=bw2074)

elements.title: BloombergNEF and Schneider Electric report finds rooftop solar market still largely untapped
elements.description: Careful Policy Design Could Unlock Massive Rooftop Solar Market Around The World: market still largely untapped with potential to exceed 2,000 gigawatts of solar and 1,000 gigawatt-hours of energy storage by 2050. Report available [here](https://assets.bbhub.io/professional/sites/24/BNEF-Schneider-Electric-Realizing-the-Potential-of-Customer-Sited-Solar_FINAL.pdf). In [the news](https://www.energymonitor.ai/tech/energy-storage/energy-storage-makes-the-business-case-for-on-site-solar)

elements.title: Future homes standard
elements.description: UK govt ambitious uplift in the energy efficiency of new homes. [In Nov 2021](https://www.edie.net/news/11/Boris-Johnson-confirms-mandatory-EV-charging-points-for-new-buildings-in-England/) PM Johnson delivered a speech to the Confederation of British Industry (CBI) announcing mandatory EV charging points for new buildings in England

elements.title: Heat and buildings strategy
elements.description: This strategy sets out how the UK will decarbonise our homes, and our commercial, industrial and public sector buildings, as part of setting a path to net zero by 2050.

elements.title: Greening Finance: A Roadmap to Sustainable Investing
elements.description: This document sets out the government’s ambition to make the UK the best place in the world for green and sustainable investment.

elements.title: New 5-year SolarPower Europe Market Outlook
elements.description: The forecast for household solar continues to look bright for coming years, with European solar & storage set to grow over 400%, from 3 GWh installed storage capacity in 2020 to 12.8 GWh in 2025. SolarPower Europe has published its annual ‘European Market Outlook for Residential Battery Storage’ report, covering 2021-2025.

elements.title: Transport decarbonisation plan
elements.description: Plan to decarbonise the entire transport system in the UK. Widely reported in the news: from [Edie](https://www.edie.net/news/11/-Clarity-and-confidence-for-the-road-ahead---Green-economy-reacts-to-new-Transport-Decarbonisation-Plan/), from [UKERC](https://ukerc.ac.uk/news/uk-transport-decarbonisation-plan/)

elements.title: E.ON calls on Government to level-up UK’s low-carbon efforts to achieve net zero
elements.description: In its new report, [‘The Carbon Countdown: Road to 2030’](https://www.eonenergy.com/business/news-and-insights/tomorrow-is-on/accelerating-towards-a-net-zero-future.html), E.ON explores the key areas where the UK must move faster and with greater focus in this decade if it intends to meet its 2050 carbon goals.

elements.title: Energy white paper: Powering our net zero future
elements.description: Energy white paper setting out how the UK will clean up its energy system and reach net zero emissions by 2050.
